2014-03-31.abstract: Battle between Apple and Samsung has Google caught in crossfire, since some features in Samsung devices that Apple objects to are part of Google's Android system; Apple is seeking in lawsuit about $2 billion from Samsung for selling phones and tablets that Apple says violate five of its mobile software patents; Samsung, meanwhile, says Apple violated two of its patents.

2014-03-31.lead_paragraph: A House subcommittee will open hearings on Tuesday looking into why federal investigators never realized there was a problem with certain G.M. ignition systems.
2014-03-31.abstract: Newly released memo reports that National Highway Traffic Safety Administration decided not to open inquiries into General Motors despite investigations in 2007 and 2010 revealing fatal ignition flaw that prevented air bags from deploying; memo also reveals that GM had approved faulty design in 2002 even though company that made the part, Delphi Corp, had warned that switch did not meet specifications.

2014-03-31.snippet: The legislation, the focus of intense lobbying from all sides, is meant to ensure equitable Internet access for 500 million Europeans....
2014-03-31.lead_paragraph: The legislation, the focus of intense lobbying from all sides, is meant to ensure equitable Internet access for 500 million Europeans.
2014-03-31.abstract: European Union's 28 member countries plan to vote on digital policy legislation regarding online habits of 500 million consumers; crucial part of legislation is so-called net neutrality, rules meant to ensure equitable access to Internet for services like streaming music, on-demand television and cloud computing; key questions are who pays for services, and how much.

headline.main: European Lawmakers Prepare to Vote on ‘Net Neutrality’
headline.print_headline: European Lawmakers Prepare to Vote on Contentious ‘Net Neutrality’
